name: TheAtlantic
text: The question isn't whether "The Crown" bends history—of course it does—but what effect those distortions have. @helenlewis on the national mythology being created by the blockbuster Netflix series: https://t.co/7S0Vk7Ftb8

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: It's a bit weird to debate whether The Crown is accurate (it's a drama!). But as @helenlewis eloquently notes, it does matter: the show is telling Britain a story about itself, and is shifting the national conversation as culture before it did https://t.co/7dgOalrFWH

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @helenlewis: I wrote about whether The Crown should have a warning label to say that it's fiction: https://t.co/PTLZmp646N

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @helenlewis: "The real source of unease with The Crown comes from the dissonance between the high naturalism of the program’s costumes, staging, and set design and the liberties taken with its plotlines."

https://t.co/PTLZmpnEYl

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @mimbsy: it's a good weekend for some poetry: https://t.co/4bJS9nLdqT

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: “Miley Cyrus... is always molting from a pudding-mouthed mumble into a dragon-fire geyser. There is also a Miley Cyrus attitude, which blends cheekiness, earnestness, and a feeling that she’s returning the camera’s gaze with hundredfold intensity.” https://t.co/jSUeeCAut4

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @olgakhazan: If you haven’t already made time for this powerful and urgent @elainejgodfrey piece, be sure you do: https://t.co/uFXJzESj9l

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @edyong209: "Americans are dying of COVID-19 who, had they gotten sick a month earlier, would have lived." 

It is happening. Hospitals are being overwhelmed. 

Present tense, not future. 

Read @alexismadrigal and @yayitsrob's latest. 

https://t.co/iYTo3np7Pz

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @yayitsrob: NEW, by me and @alexismadrigal:

Faced with an unprecedented surge in cases, hospitals are now overwhelmed. 

They are running out of beds and too slammed to provide high-quality care. The pandemic nightmare scenario is here—you can see it in the data.

https://t.co/tCl5GwFD5V

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @bartongellman: "next summer will be happy and prosperous, and we will... grin at one another like children in June. But the world will be reduced, and not as wise, because tens of thousands of Americans will be dead when they should be alive." https://t.co/qJ2jONHxUw @yayitsrob @alexismadrigal

name: TheAtlantic
TheAtlantic
text: "It is up to Biden to save millions of lives and billions of dollars, to the detriment of the tobacco industry and few others," @AnnieLowrey writes: https://t.co/tCOhcr4g9M

name: TheAtlantic
text: Georgia Republican Gabe Sterling spends every day with “horrible cognitive dissonance.” But he tells @isaacdovere that he’s committed to doing his job. https://t.co/1rrNdEkqxp

name: TheAtlantic
text: Six suggestions for another weekend at home in the latest The Atlantic Daily by @mimbsy. https://t.co/bBKDWHVCWV

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "[I]t is not philistine or unsophisticated to challenge what a writer has chosen to pull from the messy stuff of mere events. It is vital."

Brilliant piece from @helenlewis:
https://t.co/62x76JNuwa

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: "When a historical drama is setting pallets of $100 bills on fire with every second of screentime, it creates an expectation of authenticity." @helenlewis on The Crown is, as you'd expect, excellent https://t.co/7dgOalrFWH

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JohnGHendy: Quite the quote:

"And it is hard, because in my state, I’m a known partisan. It’s not like I’m just a random person. I mean, I’ve run for office as a Republican. I am a known entity." https://t.co/hSZir1EH0w via @IsaacDovere

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "Theater chains are right to fear for their survival. And WarnerMedia’s move, which seems more motivated by panic than a desire for long-term success, is a risky bet for studios, too." --  @davidlsims:
https://t.co/G1Sls3wwbk

name: TheAtlantic
text: WarnerMedia’s decision to put all of its 2021 movies on HBO Max is a shortsighted decision that will have major repercussions for Hollywood, @davidlsims argues. https://t.co/zLOm4uETq9

name: TheAtlantic
text: Physicists have made the most precise measurement ever of a "magic number" that shapes the universe. @nattyover reports for @QuantaMagazine: https://t.co/qNCaPyo5qy
